segments.text: I'd like to book a ticket to Shanghai .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: When would you like to fly ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: As soon as possible . Do you have a flight tomorrow ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I will check , please hold on . Sorry to say that flight is all booked up . Can I book you for the 3rd of September ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That will be OK .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: How many people are there in your party ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Just me this time .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What class will you fly ? First class ? Business class ? Or economy class ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Economy class will be fine .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Round trip or one way trip ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I would like to book a one way trip ticket .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: How will you pay , cash or charge ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I would like to pay by check .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I am sorry , we do not accept checks .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'll pay by charge card then .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Great . What name shall I put the reservation under ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Lucy Green .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You are booked , Ms . Green .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Thanks a lot .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It's a pleasure .
segments.speaker: S2
